events.title: Death of Roman Emperor Claudius
events.description: Roman Emperor Claudius died, possibly poisoned, leading to the succession of Nero as the emperor of Rome.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of Nero's reign, which significantly impacted the Roman Empire's history.

events.title: Arrest of the Knights Templar in France
events.description: King Philip IV of France ordered the mass arrest of the Knights Templar, accusing them of heresy and leading to the eventual dissolution of the order.
events.significance: This event led to the end of the powerful Knights Templar and had lasting effects on medieval European politics and finance.

events.title: First Coal Mine Disaster in the United States
events.description: A coal mine explosion in Pennsylvania killed several miners, marking the first recorded coal mining disaster in U.S. history.
events.significance: Highlighted the dangers of early industrial work and led to awareness about mining safety.

events.title: Apollo 17 Launch
events.description: NASA launched Apollo 17, the final mission of the Apollo lunar landing program, which included the last astronauts to walk on the moon.
events.significance: Marked the last manned moon landing of the 20th century, contributing substantial scientific data about the moon.
